byline.contributor: Jared Malsin contributed reporting from Cairo.

abstract: Mexican government announces it will seek compensation on behalf of six citizens who survived deadly attack by Egyptian military, from helicopter, on group of Mexican tourists; Egyptian government says tourists were mistaken for Islamic State militants, but circumstances remain murky, and Mexican government repeats its demands for an official investigation.
lead_paragraph: The circumstances of the attack in Egypt’s Western Desert that killed 12 people remain murky as officials called for an investigation and compensation for the victims.

headline.main: Mexican Tourists Wounded in Egyptian Air Attack Return Home
headline.print_headline: Mexican Tourists Home After Attack in Egypt

snippet: The circumstances of the attack in Egypt’s Western Desert that killed 12 people remain murky as officials called for an investigation and compensation for the victims.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
